Tahiti sightseeing optional add-ons Tahiti Museum & Circle Island Tour - Half Day Afternoon Tour This is the perfect half day tour to discover some of the treasures of Tahiti. The tour starts along the west coast with a visit to the Museum of Tahiti & Her Islands, the country’s fist institution to showcase the treasures of Polynesia’s natural & cultural heritage. Next, head for the Vaipahi water garden for a refreshing stroll among pools, waterfalls, flowers and tropical plants. After crossing the isthmus of the Tahiti Iti peninsula, the landscape of the east coast becomes wilder - it's still a bit of the Tahiti of yesteryear. A few kilometres further on, make a stop at Trou du Souffleur, a marine geyser known in ancient times as Anahoho "the howling cave", before heading into the forest to the 3 Te Fa'aurumai waterfalls natural site. End your tour of the island with a visit to Pointe Vénus, where the Endeavour docked in 1769, Captain Cook's ship of exploration on a mission to observe the passage of Venus in front of the sun in 77 countries. Pricing based on hotel pick up and drop off from select Papeete accommodation. This Tour combines food tastings while discovering Tahiti's history walking through the city's emblematic places and, witnessing this Polynesian cultural melting pot. It is, with this mix that gives the local culinary culture its signature with the snacks and Tahitian favourite sweet & salty treats. 10 to 12 tastings are included depending on the season and the availability of vendors during the tour. Your guide will be present throughout the journey and will answer any questions you may have about local flora and fauna and geology.
